description: Intermediate high school chemistry covering quantum theory, electron configurations, advanced chemical bonding, intermolecular forces, thermochemistry, stoichiometry, gas laws, acids and bases, redox reactions, kinetics, and chemical equilibrium. Prepares students for senior-level chemistry and AP/IB courses.

topics.name: Unit 1: Quantum Mechanical Model
topics.description: Wave-particle duality, quantum numbers, electron orbitals, and principles governing electron configurations.

topics.name: Unit 2: Electron Configuration & Periodicity
topics.description: Electron configuration rules, periodic trends, ionization energy, atomic/ionic radii, and chemical reactivity.

topics.name: Unit 3: Advanced Chemical Bonding I
topics.description: Covalent bonding theory, hybridization, molecular shapes, bond polarity, and resonance structures.

topics.name: Unit 4: Advanced Chemical Bonding II
topics.description: Metallic bonding, network solids, electron delocalization, molecular orbital theory, and bonding energy concepts.

topics.name: Unit 5: Intermolecular Forces & Properties
topics.description: London dispersion, dipole-dipole, hydrogen bonding, physical properties, boiling/melting points, and viscosity.

topics.name: Unit 6: Thermochemistry Basics
topics.description: Enthalpy, calorimetry, Hess's Law, heat capacity, and energy changes in chemical reactions.

topics.name: Unit 7: Quantitative Chemistry & The Mole
topics.description: Stoichiometry, mole conversions, limiting reactants, percent yield, and empirical/molecular formulas.

topics.name: Unit 8: Gas Laws & Kinetic Theory
topics.description: Ideal gas law, gas stoichiometry, kinetic molecular theory, partial pressures, and real gases.

topics.name: Unit 9: Acids, Bases & Titrations
topics.description: pH and pOH calculations, strong/weak acids and bases, titration curves, and indicators.

topics.name: Unit 10: Redox Reactions & Electrochemistry
topics.description: Oxidation-reduction reactions, balancing redox equations, electrochemical cells, and standard electrode potentials.

topics.name: Unit 11: Chemical Kinetics & Mechanisms
topics.description: Reaction rates, rate laws, collision theory, reaction mechanisms, and activation energy calculations.

topics.name: Unit 12: Chemical Equilibrium
topics.description: Dynamic equilibrium, Le Chatelier's principle, equilibrium constants (Kc, Kp), and calculations involving concentrations and pressures.
